title: How to Say "How Are You" in Nepali

steps.title: Say "तिमीलाई कस्तो छ?"
steps.content: Say "तिमीलाई कस्तो छ?" This is pronounced "tee-mee-lai kas-to chuh". This is supposed to be said casually, to a friend, or someone your age. It is best not to say this in a formal environment.

steps.title: Use "तिमि कसरी हो?"
steps.content: Use "तिमि कसरी हो?" as a less common alternative. It is pronounced "tee-mee kas-ree ho."

steps.title: Use ""तपाईलाई कस्तो छ?"
steps.content: Use ""तपाईलाई कस्तो छ?" for formal settings. This is pronounced "tapai-lai kas-to Chha."

steps.title: Replace "तपाईलाई कस्तो छ" with "तपाई कसरी हो", (pronounced tapai kas-ree ho) as an alternative.
steps.content: Replace "तपाईलाई कस्तो छ" with "तपाई कसरी हो", (pronounced tapai kas-ree ho) as an alternative. Keep in mind that it isn't used too often.

steps.title: Know that the only difference between the informal and the formal way of saying this is the replacement of "तिमी" with "तपाई".
steps.content: Know that the only difference between the informal and the formal way of saying this is the replacement of "तिमी" with "तपाई". Both, however, mean "you".

steps.title: To reply to "how are you?"
steps.content: To reply to "how are you?" in Nepali, say "मलाइ सन्चै छ" which is pronounced as "ma-laai san-che chuh" and means "I'm doing well."

steps.title: Use a simpler alternative if desired.
steps.content: Use a simpler alternative if desired. Try "म ठिक छु" which means "I'm fine." It is pronounced as "ma tick choo".

steps.title: Ask someone back.
steps.content: Ask someone back. To do this, just say "तिम्रो के छ?" pronounced "tim-ro kay-chuh".
